title: Waistcoat, ca. 1795
medium:
Medium: silk, cotton
Technique: knotted net over silk 4&1 satin, cotton lining
dimensions: H x W (closed): 62 x 40 cm (24 7/16 x 15 3/4 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund
description: Men's double-breasted waistcoat with high standing collar, cut straight at the waist.  Waistcoat is patterned with stripes, and is comprised of the colors brown, peach, and cream.   There are seven worked buttonholes down front, with a row of matching silk covered buttons on either side. It is lined with unbleached cotton.
